author: 80raghavendra
content:
I am exploring ways to use light clients for Bridges. Suppose I configure my bridge to use blocks when they are validated by at least 2/3 of the Sync committee. Then is the following confusing scenario possible?

-  A block is attested correctly with the normal beacon committees but the sync committee attestation falls short of 2/3rd possible.

Question: In that case is it correct for our bridge nodes to reject such a block?

author: 80raghavendra
content: Or is it the case that a block is valid only if 2/3 of the Sync committee has signed it?

author: 80raghavendra
content: Where do I get the light client and server implementations? Are they being used currently?

author: ralexstokes
content:
you use the sync committees bc you don’t have the resources otherwise to process the full consensus 

so in this case you follow the sync committee security model which gives you safety up to your threshold, here 2/3

author: ralexstokes
content: if this is the case then the bridge would only accept an update if it had the required amount of signatures

author: ralexstokes
content: there would be no way to efficiently know anything about the activity of the broader validator set

author: ralexstokes
content: different teams have various different implementations at different levels of “production readiness”, id check out lodestar or nimbus
